This was the first time I have rented with Airbnb.
Barb and Ray's daughter helped make check-in and our visit go smoothly.
Garage parking and heated flooring were each a bonus.
Try relaxing in their modern, corner-unit sauna; very therapeutic.
We saw lots of deer and birds through large, attractive windows in the upstairs living room. The house and amenities are dated, yet well-kept, and mostly clean.
It is spacious, despite two of the rooms being locked. We were traveling as only a couple of humans, so the modest bed in the basement was serviceable enough. The high ceilings and sky light in the kitchen made the outdoors feel closer.
The hosts left a cheerful note about the house and area. Clean towels and thoughtful toiletries were a kind and welcoming gesture, although silly us: we traveled with our own. O:)
In stride with the helpfulness of our hosts, it was admittedly challenging to try to see past-- and relax amongst-- the dozens of prominently placed family photos, religious affects, and political displays. Given being in the beautiful UP was the main goal of our visit, I did my best to content myself with the views from windows instead. It was the first time I wished a place seemed more like a hotel in a way, as I had arrived with the understanding personal effects are meant to be kept to a minimum. I felt a little embarrassed that I had not at least had coffee with the family before seeing so much of their personal life.
If you rent this spot, take comfort in this:
I suppose the family photos, and political and religious displays would be put away if the hosts felt embarrassed about them. 😇 Different strokes, different folks: maybe you won't mind what was distracting to me.
Distracting kitsch aside, the house is overall nice.
Thank you again, Barb and Ray!

Ray and Barb's daughter, Emelie, was also a fantastic, helpful contact/co-host. All this--plus the adorable town of Iron Mountain and fun activities in the area--made for the best work-cation we could have asked for.
